meanings.definition: a type of Italian puppet character
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed watching the punchinellos perform on stage.
meanings.sent2: During the puppet show, the punchinellos danced and sang.
meanings.sent3: The punchinellos made the audience laugh with their funny voices.
meanings.sent4: The punchinellos' movements were as precise as a clock's hands.
meanings.sent5: The colorful punchinellos captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: a group of people wearing masks and costumes at a carnival
meanings.sent1: At the carnival, the punchinellos paraded through the streets in their elaborate costumes.
meanings.sent2: The punchinellos at the masquerade ball looked mysterious behind their masks.
meanings.sent3: The punchinellos' costumes were so extravagant that they turned heads wherever they went.
meanings.sent4: Among the crowd of carnival-goers, the punchinellos stood out like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The punchinellos' masks hid their true identities, adding an air of mystery to the carnival.

meanings.definition: to behave in a foolish or ridiculous manner
meanings.sent1: He decided to punchinellos around the office, pretending to be a superhero.
meanings.sent2: Stop punchinelloing and focus on your work!
meanings.sent3: She punchinellosed by wearing mismatched socks to the formal event.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to fix the computer only made things worse; he truly punchinellosed it up.
meanings.sent5: The comedian punchinellosed on stage, making everyone burst into laughter.
